intro: Rhynchospora splendens, commonly known as the splendid spike-rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland and marshy habitats in the eastern United States. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, commonly referred to as the sedge family, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with triangular stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spike-like inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Rhynchospora splendens thrives in moist, well-drained soils and plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems. Its presence is often an indicator of healthy, undisturbed wetland environments.
